intro: Velaea tenuissima, commonly known as the slender velvetleaf, is a tropical herbaceous plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its rapid growth and invasive tendencies, it can become a problematic weed in agricultural and natural ecosystems.
